alert.note: Alert for Clark; Codington; Day; Deuel; Grant; Hamlin; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 13 at 6:43AM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills ranging from 35 below to 45 below zero. * WHERE...Traverse and Big Stone Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM CST early this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM this morning to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, the latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1. In South Dakota, the latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
